physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Loud holosystolic murmur consistent with mitral regurgitation was auscultated. The patient remained afebrile with no evidence of heart failure or systemic embolic phenomena.

Patient reported no cardiopulmonary symptoms and was able to hike 5 to 7 miles without dyspnea or fatigue. A transthoracic echocardiogram showed normal biventricular cavity size, systolic function, and estimated pulmonary artery systolic pressure.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Transthoracic echocardiogram obtained 5 years prior to the accident was normal, indicating no evidence of valvular pathology at that time.
